availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To His Excellency B Magoffin Govr of Kentucky
You Petitioner Susan Parker States that on the Frankfort Police Court She was fined $41_ upon a charge of a breach of the Peace
She States that no person was Seriously injured in the fight between her and Mary Arnold that She is poor and unable to pay the fine
She prays that your Excellency will remit Said fine
We pray your Excellency to remit the above named fine

John L. Scott
Geo. W. Monroe
Q. L Phythian
H I Todd
D W Lindsey City Atty
A. H. Rennick
W. H. Sneed
Lewis Cheetz
James Harlan Jr
W H Greenup
Nelson Alley
R. C. Steele
W H Ferill
Jno Rodman
John R Graham
James M Todd
W,, H,, Gray
G W Gorin
M Owen
Jno. W. Crutcher
Ed. Keenon
Geo. W. Robb
W S Delaney
R. Runyan
H R Powell
G W Lewis
I was present at the trial engaged as counsel, (not for the petitioner) and became consider it a proper case for the exercise of executive clemency continued further the other side.

D. M. Bowen
J. W. South
E Whitesides
L. Tobin
J. M. Bowen
Jas O Sneed
